sentences.english: I don’t want them to rot in no-man’s land.
sentences.chinese: 我不想讓他們在荒郊野外腐爛。

sentences.english: Before modern history , Yangshupu was in the wild Huangpu river alone.
sentences.chinese: 近代以前，楊樹浦是僻處黃浦江畔的荒郊地帶。

sentences.english: You started to think polar bear thoughts about icyness and wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 你開始想北極熊所想，想冰封的大地，想荒郊野外。

sentences.english: With that, she was turned into a large stone and was placed in the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 於是女孩變成一塊大石頭，躺在荒郊野外。

sentences.english: Maybe, but it'll probably be out in the wilds.
sentences.chinese: 有可能，不過也許要到荒郊野外的地方纔能找到。

sentences.english: Hey Hey, will having never thought this wild countryside open nation also have a beauty?
sentences.chinese: 嘿嘿，沒想到這荒郊野外也會有美人？

sentences.english: In the wilderness of the bridge, while, the growth with a plum trees.
sentences.chinese: 在荒郊野外的斷橋邊，生長着一株梅樹。

sentences.english: You got any breakfast out here in the boonies ?
sentences.chinese: 在這種荒郊野外有早餐嗎？

sentences.english: All the long night, wild village open country, the this Gu masculine few petticoat lives alone to do what good which?
sentences.chinese: 漫漫長夜，荒郊野外，這孤男寡女的獨處做什麼好哪？

sentences.english: He lives in a lonely place alone.

definition: dark and uninhabited (idiom); remote and deserted/God-forsaken
to sleep outdoors/to spend the night in the open
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
